description: From Late Latin superērogātiō (“payment in addition”), from superērogāre (“to pay in addition”), from super (“in addition to”) + ērogāre (“I pay, pay out, expend, disburse”), equivalent to supererogate +‎ -ion.

entries.meaning: An act of doing more than is required.
(philosophy) An action that is neither morally forbidden nor required, but has moral value.
